definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: Not every idiom translates with such ease.
sentences.chinese: 要鬧清楚每個習慣用語的意思是不容易的。

sentences.english: There has been a great deal of politician's cant .
sentences.chinese: 說了一大堆政客慣用的言不由衷的話。

sentences.english: And a number of different sports have contributed idioms to the English language.
sentences.chinese: 許多不同的運動都爲英語貢獻了很多習慣用語。

sentences.english: This was originally a term used in the theater.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個源自劇場的慣用語。

sentences.english: That attitude affects idiomatic patterns as well.
sentences.chinese: 此態度也影響了慣用模式。

sentences.english: Homosexuals have also made it a practice to dump on religious leaders.
sentences.chinese: 同性戀者也以詰難宗教領袖爲慣用手法。

sentences.english: We adopt the warehouse to warehouse clause which is commonlcdfds. com used in international insurance.
sentences.chinese: 採用國際保險中慣用的“倉對倉”的責任條款。

sentences.english: Try to Remember idioms and sentences with the first calling, make sure to remember deeply.
sentences.chinese: 儘量用第一人稱來記習慣用語和句型，以便記憶牢固。

sentences.english: He always includes a few folk songs on his programs; they are his stock in trade .
sentences.chinese: 在他的節目中總是包括幾首民謠，那是他的慣用手段。

sentences.english: Friendly persuasion is the stock-in-trade of every salesman.
sentences.chinese: 友好的勸說是每個推銷員的慣用手法。

sentences.english: There are quite a lot of three-character idioms playing an active role in Cantonese.
sentences.chinese: 廣州話裏活躍着許多三字格慣用語。

sentences.english: What troubles me most is that I can't learn all these English idioms by heart.
sentences.chinese: 最困擾我的是我無法背誦出所有這些英語慣用語。

sentences.english: For the relationship between handedness and speech lateralization , see Chapter four.
sentences.chinese: 慣用手和語言側化的關係，見第四章。

sentences.english: Resembling or having the nature of an idiom.
sentences.chinese: 要鬧清楚每個習慣用語的意思是不容易的。

sentences.english: I have found an idiomatic pattern.
sentences.chinese: 我發現了一個慣用模式。

definition: to differentiate/to draw a distinction/to divide into categories
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
to act as/used erroneously for 作為|作为
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
